p.k: The Pocket Party series (Les Soirées de Poche) consists of musical sessions and concerts recorded in intimate settings. This concert by Canadian singer-songwriter Leslie Feist was recorded in 2011.
p.d: The Pocket Party series (Les Soirées de Poche) consists of musical sessions and concerts recorded in intimate settings. The many artists and bands that perform there are representatives of a wide range of musical styles, from jazz to soul, and funk to R&B. This concert by Canadian singer-songwriter Leslie Feist was recorded in 2011. After debuting as a guitarist in a punk band, Feist decided to go solo and currently has six solo albums under her name. Her most popular pieces include the famous "1234" and "Limit to your Love", popularized by a cover of James Blake. In this concert, Feist is accompanied by Brian Lebarton, Lucky Paul, Charles Spearin, and The Mountain Man.
